page.title: 15Transport
page.content: The Manchester Ship Canal is a considerable man-made barrier between Cadishead-Hollins Green and Partington - Warburton areas.East - west travel across the canal is by {Warburton High Level Bridge A toll bridge that has access off the main Manchester Rd.via Bridge Rd and then over the canal into Warburton village.Toll fees are collected at a barrier on the Warburton side.It has a 5ton.weight limit,costs 12.5p.for heavy vehicles,10p.for cars and 5p. for motor-cycles. {Bob's Ferry} Small passenger motor - boat (15-20 people) that sails the canal every 10mins.between Bob's Lane Cadishead and a path that leads to Lock Lane in Partington.The cost each way is 10 pence.
